reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Empowering Women for Business Success

description.narrative: 1. Project: 12083 Empowering Women for Business Success 2. Project area and Country: Delta and Rakhine State, Myanmar 3. Project justification: The core challenges in the Delta region (Ayeyarwaddy and Yangon) and Rakhine state remain low income, low cro p productivity, poor and insufficient infrastructure and poor access to their rights. A lack of market based information and linkages, modern production techniques and access to capital have limited the sustainability and impact of rural livelihoods initia tives. Women?s groups and individuals still have limited capacity in terms of entrepreneurship and business skills, both individually and as a part of groups or collectives. Migration of youth and abled elders is common in both areas. Moreover, both areas located in potential disaster risk areas, and disaster preparedness and response mechanisms remain limited. 4. The main objective and the expected results: The goal of the project is that women in poor and vulnerable households in the Delta and Rakhine St ate are empowered through sustainable livelihoods. The impact of the project will be a reduction of poverty in the target areas, and a contribution to sustainable, people-centred socio-economic development with improved gender equality and women?s empowerm ent. This will be accomplished through increased household income and assets for women in poor and vulnerable households in target areas. The project will also increase control and decision-making by women. The project will also enhance capacity of duty-be arers and other stakeholders to support the sustainable livelihoods of women in poor and vulnerable households.5. Right-holders/ beneficiaries: 1,554 women in 74 communitiesDuty bearers: Local government, private sector, civil society stakeholders6. Imple menting partner: LWF Myanmar
